metadata.titel_preek: Advent: The Deepest Place in the Church Year

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the apocalyptic nature of Advent, the role of the doorkeeper (Mark), and the fiery witness of John the Baptist (Matthew). It focuses on the 'collision of ages' and the necessity of repentance.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher moves beyond moralism to the 'apocalyptic transvision,' situating the text in its original crisis-context and theological depth.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the reality of God's coming and commands vigilance, but shifts toward promising God's power as the only source of change.
voorbeelden: The power that is coming is not our power.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To create a sense of urgency, to strip away false security (Gucci luggage), and to instill hope in the external power of God.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The preacher speaks of 'power from outside' and 'God's power,' though the Spirit is not explicitly named as the agent of the sermon's effect until the formal prayer.

voorbeelden: The church calendar is not the same as the world’s calendar.
John the Baptist sets the tone.
It is dark early at this time of year.
If you find this tension almost unbearable...
A power from outside is coming... able to make a new creation.
We are able to repent... because he is coming.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological grounding, but often phrased in the 3rd person ('He will come') rather than the direct 1st/2nd person address ('He comes to you').

voorbeelden: It means that you are being changed.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher declares the 'now' of the Gospel but relies heavily on the text's authority rather than a direct sacramental 'I declare to you'.

indicatoren: Historical description of the young church's crisis.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a theological reality rather than a participant in a current event.

missende_elementen: Direct personal promise ('I promise you in His name')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer knows *about* the coming power but may not feel *addressed* by it.

voorbeelden: It means that you are being changed and I am being changed.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Inclusive 'we' and 'I' to build solidarity in the crisis.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct questions about status symbols and the command to watch.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used mostly in directives (commands) rather than commissives (promises).

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the Church, John the Baptist, and the Master.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a grand narrative sweep but keeps the 'Master' as a character in a story.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Biblical history and the first century church.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions of Advent and repentance.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the collision and the current change in the hearer.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Asserts the crisis -> Declares the inability of the self -> Promises the power of the One who comes.
voorbeelden: I don’t need to hear exhortations to repent. I need power... A power from outside is coming.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent theological movement; the promise is the pivot.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: We are able to repent and bear fruit because he is coming.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a constative surplus in word count, the sermon's internal logic is performative. It aims to strip the hearer of self-reliance to make room for the 'Event' of God's coming.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The power that is coming is not our power... It is God’s power.
sterke_punten.effect: Shifts the burden from the hearer to God.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The master has gone away, but his orders are...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Keeps the 'event' in the realm of a parable/story.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon creates a 'now' through its apocalyptic language, making the arrival of the Word feel imminent.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Strongly epiphanic, though it stops just short of a direct 'I pronounce you' declarative.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, the preacher claims the Word is everything.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, explicitly stated: 'The preacher is nothing; the Word is everything.'
tekstueel_bewijs: The preaching is from God—all for the purpose of revealing Jesus.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Only in the formal prayer, not in the homiletical theory of the sermon body.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the 'power from outside' implies the Spirit's work.
tekstueel_bewijs: Give us grace... through him who liveth and reigneth with thee and the Holy Ghost.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the 'beam' of the spotlight.
tekstueel_bewijs: John himself disappears; his preaching is the beam.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' (assertive) and 'must' (directive). It needs more 'I give/I promise' (commissive).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The power that is coming is not our power.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: This power is coming to you now, to make you new.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth to a direct address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are often about 'the church' or 'we' in general.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the singular 'you' to bring the promise home.
voorbeeldzinnen: Christ promises you today that your Gucci luggage does not define you; His love does.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Maintain the current use of 'you' but link it more to Declaratives.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of apocalyptic preaching that uses language to break down the hearer's world to make room for God's world.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the 'appeal' of John the Baptist; SAT sees John's words as a creative force that actually 'lays the axe' to the hearer's root.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: This isn't just persuasion; it's an attempt to let the Word 'happen' to the listener.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the preacher's 'Assertive' about the power of God is the necessary locutionary precursor to the 'Commissive' act of the Gospel.

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Collapses the distance between the biblical text and the hearer.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'talking about' trap by using high-intensity apocalyptic imagery that functions performatively.
